Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee exclusion based on criminal inadmissibility

Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration and refugee law, international refugee protection principles
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Sufficient evidence to establish equivalency between foreign and Canadian offenses

Crimes.Legal_Statute: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), UN Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Equivalency test for foreign crimes: statutory comparison, evidentiary sufficiency, or hybrid approach
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Improper equivalency determination, consideration of acquitted charge
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Article 1F(b) exclusion requires serious non-political crime equivalent to Canadian offense

Crimes.Credibility: Not central; focus was on legal interpretation and procedural fairness

Crimes.Legal_Basis: Conviction for indecent assault deemed potentially equivalent to sexual interference
